meanings.definition: To move by turning over and over
meanings.sent1: The cat will roll on the grass.
meanings.sent2: I like to roll down the hill for fun.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy will roll around in the mud.
meanings.sent4: The waves roll onto the shore gently.
meanings.sent5: The snowball will roll down the hill quickly.

meanings.sent1: I enjoy having a roll with my soup.
meanings.sent2: She made delicious rolls for breakfast.
meanings.sent3: The bakery sells fresh rolls every morning.
meanings.sent4: The dinner table was set with warm rolls.
meanings.sent5: The sandwich was made with a soft roll.

meanings.definition: A list of names or items
meanings.sent1: The teacher called out the roll for attendance.
meanings.sent2: I need to check the roll to see who is present.
meanings.sent3: The roll of students was neatly organized.
meanings.sent4: The roll of ingredients needed for the recipe was long.
meanings.sent5: The roll of guests invited to the party was extensive.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, deep sound
meanings.sent1: The thunder will roll across the sky.
meanings.sent2: The drums roll loudly during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The old truck will roll down the street with a loud noise.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the train will roll through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm will roll in the distance.

meanings.definition: To register or be registered officially
meanings.sent1: I need to roll for the upcoming event.
meanings.sent2: The students will roll for their classes online.
meanings.sent3: The participants will roll for the competition by tomorrow.
meanings.sent4: The athletes will roll for the tournament next week.
meanings.sent5: The voters will roll for the election in November.
